replies.body:
>(I genuinely want to know how much money Riot makes off this in the first week though)

They wouldn't let us know how much cosmic reaver kassadin made for charity, they definitely are not telling you how much a skin makes ever.

That said, probably hundreds of millions.

> [{quoted}](name=JasonWazza,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=wKXhEUQp,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-04-07T00:43:25.169+0000)
>
> That said, probably hundreds of millions.

Lol, not even close.

LoL isn't that popular that one skin sells for 'hundreds of millions'. I'm going to say about 1 million max.

Actually, hundreds of millions might not be that far-fetched.

If we consider that God Fist costs 1820RP, which (after some math) comes out at approximately $17.50 AUD (or approximately $13 USD), assume a relatively similar number of regular players as in 2014 (as stated on the [Riot Games](http://www.riotgames.com/articles/20140711/1322/league-players-reach-new-heights-2014) website) being approximately 70 million monthly players, and assume 1% of those players will purchase the skin we get approximately $122.5 million AUD (or $91 million USD).

At this point there's no way to know how many regular players will purchase the skin (it could be 0.1% or even 5%), how many non-regular players will purchase the skin (which could have a significant impact) and (despite the some of LoLs and Riots shortcomings) I think it's safe to assume there's a significantly larger "regular" player base now when compared to 2014, so it is possible (given the statistics available to us) that a profit of hundreds of millions isn't out of the question, but *may* be extremely unlikely.

I think it's safe to say that "$1 million max" is entirely out of the question, though, as less than 0.012% of *regular* players, based on statistics from 3 years ago, would put the total value at higher than $1 million USD.

for ultimate skins, you have to take into account the cost to buy them being significantly higher, with not a huge drop in the number of people that will buy them (especially considering this is lee sin, one of the most popular champions in the meta all the time.)

A champion with 2 dashes, 2 true sight abilities, a shield, life steal/spell vamp, a slow and a knock-back

Who invented this champ again?
